title: MITA: horários, como chegar e mais informações do festival em São Paulo
content:
Após o público vivenciar momentos marcantes na edição do MITA 2023 no Rio de Janeiro, chegou a vez de São Paulo curtir o festival. Marcado para acontecer nos dias 3 e 4 no Vale do Anhangabaú, o evento promete promover muita música e experiências únicas para os fãs com 17 atrações confirmadas.
Além disso, o MITA terá uma área para a reflexão e discussão sobre a importância da atuação de toda a sociedade em ações de responsabilidade social e ambiental. As instituições Instituto Vida Livre e The Friendship Circle estarão presentes no evento apresentando suas propostas de ação, projetos desenvolvidos e resultados concretos alcançados.
Para você já ir se preparando, separamos algumas informações importantes sobre o festival.
Line-up e programação
Diversas atrações musicais se apresentarão no evento durante o fim de semana e a programação está dividida entre Palco Centro e Palco Deezer. No sábado, Lana Del Rey é a principal atração da noite, com o show previsto para começar às 20h20. Já no domingo, Florence + The Machine se apresenta também às 20h20.
Confira a programação de horários completa:
Como chegar e acessos
O acesso ao festival será feito por duas entradas, uma embaixo do Viaduto do Chá, que fica a 5 minutos da Estação Metrô Anhangabaú, e outra na Avenida São João, a 8 minutos da Estação do Metrô São Bento. Ou seja, para chegar em uma das estações, é preciso usar as linhas vermelha e azul, respectivamente.
Vale lembrar que o evento não tem estacionamento conveniado.
O festival também contará com dois espaços PCDs, sendo um para cada palco. Nos portões do evento, será distribuído um QRCode com um vídeo de informações gerais e de segurança, em Libras e Áudio descrição, como a localização dos banheiros, a lista e horários das atrações de cada palco e os recursos de acessibilidade disponíveis.
Nos pontos de venda de alimentos e bebidas haverá balcões rebaixados, assim como informações em braile e com acesso via QrCode, para facilitar a compra. Um piso tátil será instalado em pontos estratégicos, para facilitar o deslocamento de deficientes visuais durante o festival, e todas as ativações promocionais terão acesso por rampas.
Continua após a publicidade
O que pode levar?
Nas redes sociais, o festival publicou uma lista de itens que são permitidos dentro do evento como capa de chuva, protetor solar, barra de cereal e etc. Já outros objetos são proibidos e serão barrados na entrada do evento, como capacetes, guarda-chuva, objetos de vidro e mais. Confira:
Serviço – MITA SÃO PAULO
Data dos shows: Dias 03 (ESGOTADOS) e 04 de junho
Abertura dos portões: 11h
Horário dos shows: a partir das 11h50
Local: Novo Anhangabaú – Vale do Anhangabaú, centro histórico de São Paulo
Ingressos: A partir de R＄ 425
Classificação etária: Acima de 16 anos desacompanhado. De 5 a 15 anos é obrigatória a presença de um responsável legal.
Venda de ingressos online: Eventim

title: “Brincadeiras” com aparência de Lana Del Rey são gordofobia disfarçada
content:
A volta de Lana Del Rey, após quatro anos longe dos palcos, aconteceu no último sábado (27), no Rio de Janeiro. Se na plateia a cantora foi muito bem recebida pelos fãs brasileiros, na internet, uma onda de comentários sobre a sua aparência ganharam espaço. Alguns deles criticavam abertamente o corpo da artista, condenando o ganho de peso, mas muitos dos posts escondiam a gordofobia por trás de “brincadeiras” – que de inofensivas ou engraçadas não tinham nada.
Ao republicar um vídeo da Lana no aeroporto do Rio de Janeiro, em que ela vestia um jeans básico, uma camiseta branca de manga longa e um casaco, um usuário tweetou que “ela tinha muita cara de que trabalha num escritório ali no centro do Rio e só saiu pra almoçar no self-service com os amigos da firma”. Em seguida, muitos outros comentários começaram a comparar a aparência da cantora com outros estereótipos de trabalhadores e pessoas mais humildes. “Ela realmente tem cara das pessoas que eu atendo no restaurante e passa vr ou ticket”, escreveu outra seguidora.
E nem todos os posts vinham de haters. Muitos fãs e pessoas que admiram a cantora acabaram entrando no que acharam que era apenas uma brincadeira. “Se chama Alana, administra empresas e nas horas vagas costuma ir a bares de esquina tomar aquela geladinha e pegar um praia aos domingos. Laninha é tudo”, tweetou uma delas, por exemplo.
Acontece que a cantora sempre optou por um estilo mais simples, só que as críticas só começaram depois que ela ganhou peso. Uma seguidora ressaltou isso: “Ela sempre foi ‘gente como a gente’, sempre usou roupas simples e não falavam isso quando ela magra. Antes ela era a ‘sad girl’, todo mundo queria ser igual, passar a mesma vibe”. Sem contar que as comparações também podem refletir um prec
Infelizmente, por conta da gordofobia, Lana e muitas outras mulheres que não estão no corpo (considerado) padrão viram alvo de ataques e “piadas” por usarem roupas que, quando estão no corpo magro, não são alvo dos mesmos comentários.
Nós mostramos aqui na CAPRICHO quando a modelo Tess Holliday sofreu várias críticas ao usar um vestido de tule com morangos bordados no Grammy Awards. Na época, o mesmo vestido era uma das peças mais populares do TikTok, com mais de 13 milhões de visualizações na hashtag #strawberrydress, que faz referência a ele.
Muitas vezes, não é só uma “brincadeira” ou o “look que não combinou”, é gordofobia – e não dá mais para deixar isso passar.

title: Scouse band's 'crazy dream' of playing Glastonbury comes true
content:
Something went wrong, please try again later.
Invalid email Something went wrong, please try again later.
Love Glastonbury? From tickets to headliners, sign up here for the latest updates from Worthy Farm
The lead singer of an emerging Scouse band has said their “crazy dream” has come true after it was announced that they would be performing at Glastonbury this year.
Stone are an indie-rock band, who played their first gig just over three years ago at The Shipping Forecast on Slater Street. As part of their recent UK tour, they performed in their hometown in April at the 02 Academy on Hotham Street.
Now, the band’s recent successes look set to continue, with frontman Fin Power announcing on Twitter this morning that they would be playing at the UK’s most famous music festival. They will be part of the BBC Music Introducing stage.
READ MORE: Maya Jama says public will choose couples in first Love Island vote
Wavertree-born Fin, who first visited Glastonbury aged five, said he was excited to show the rest of the band how “magical” the festival is. He said: “This is a crazy dream come true for us as a band and we can’t believe it really. When I was five years old I went to Glastonbury for the first time on a year when it rained and poured so badly that pretty much most of the festival was flooded.”
He added: “I remember crying loads and my mum made me carry a box of red wine so I could feel helpful. Little did I know I would be playing the same festival 18 years later that claimed my five year old tears and covered me in mud.”
Stone’s other members are Alex Smith, Sarah Surrage and Elliot Gill. Speaking to the ECHO earlier this year, Fin said they had achieved their hopes of a career in music after “grafting for seven years” through various different bands.
The group met through chance meetings at college and education. Soon after that first gig in town, they were embarking on karaoke-fuelled tours of Europe, supporting artists such as The Kooks in Portugal and Louis Tomlinson in Malaga.
Fin said: "I remember watching other bands do live tours and I envied them. I read once that it takes 20 years to become an overnight success, which rings true in our case.”
Their hits range from the politically-charged Money to the melancholic Save Yourself, with the band describing their genre of music as "post-apocalyptic scally rock". Stone's gigs, labelled as "vicious and beautiful" by Fin, have become well known among indie lovers. Their Liverpool performance earned a five star review from the ECHO.
Glastonbury 2023 will take place from June 21 to June 25. Fellow Scouser Jamie Webster will also be present at Left Field, with other confirmed acts including Lewis Capaldi, Lilzzo and Lana Del Rey.

title: Membro da equipe de Lana Del Rey xinga Brasil após ser roubado no Rio e apaga post
content:
Pouco tempo após a coluna entrar em contato com a assessoria do evento, o produtor deletou o post
Mônica Bergamo
São Paulo – SP
Um membro da equipe da cantora Lana Del Rey xingou o Brasil em um post nas redes sociais. Ele disse que o país “não merece receber música ao vivo” e que ele mal pode esperar para poder voltar para casa após ter seu celular roubado no Rio de Janeiro.
A musa do indie pop se apresentou no Mita Festival, na capital fluminense, no fim de semana passado.
O produtor Will Whitney fez um post no Instagram em que conta que teve seu celular roubado de sua mão por um motoqueiro.
“Acabei de ter o meu iPhone roubado da minha mão por um merda em cima de uma moto. Fda-se este país inteiro. Eles não merecem música ao vivo. Mal posso esperar para ir para casa” escreveu. O texto ainda era acompanhado das hashtags #FuckBrasil (vai se fder Brasil) e #GarbageHumans (lixo de humanos).
A publicação era acompanhada de uma foto do evento. Procurado, o festival afirma que o episódio ocorreu “em um passeio pessoal” na cidade, não dentro do Mita.
Pouco tempo após a coluna entrar em contato com a assessoria do evento, Will deletou o post.
Lana ainda subirá ao palco novamente neste próximo fim de semana, desta vez em São Paulo, para a edição paulistana do festival.
Hospedada no Copacabana Palace, ela foi aproveitar um dia de praia em Ipanema no domingo (28), um dia após sua apresentação.
Com os cabelos presos em uma trança e sentada sobre uma toalha fina, Lana usava um body bege decotado e de mangas compridas.
Acompanhada por um grupo de cerca de seis pessoas, ela ficou no local até por volta das 11h. As fotos da cantora viralizaram nas redes sociais.

title: Ed Sheeran, Foo Fighters, Kesha, mais
content:
“Karma” - ENHYPEN
Até no álbum mais mediano do ENHYPEN - a faixa título, “Bite Me”, tem um refrão viciante, mas é curta demais e não prende na produção - é possível encontrar pérolas. A da vez, no caso, é “Karma”, que empresta as guitarras do hard rock oitentista (nada aqui estaria fora de lugar no musical Rock of Ages) para emular o espírito - muito vendável, diga-se de passagem - de rebeldia jovem que sempre foi o maior charme do grupo. Como a faixa bem demonstra, só o que falta ao ENHYPEN é a gravadora entender o que tem nas mãos.

title: U.K. Singles Chart: ‘Miracle’ Enters Seventh Week at No. 1
content:
Calvin Harris and Ellie Goulding enter a seventh non-consecutive week at No. 1 in the U.K. with “Miracle” (Columbia), while Lana Del Rey enjoys a chart miracle of her own.
“Miracle,” the throwback rave number, is once again the most-streamed song in the U.K., as it becomes Harris’ second-longest reigning single in his homeland, passing the six-week streak for “We Found Love” with Rihanna and “Promises” with Sam Smith. It’s just one week from equaling the Scottish EDM star’s longest reign, the eight-week run for “One Kiss” with Dua Lipa.
The seven-week stretch for “Miracle” sees Goulding rise up the all-time ranks. Other female acts to enjoy seven weeks at No. 1 include Cher with “Believe” and the Spice Girls with “Wannabe.”
The highest debut this week belongs to Lana Del Rey, whose “Say Yes To Heaven” (Polydor) starts at No. 9. Originally recorded in 2012, “Say Yes” failed to secure a spot on any Del Rey album. The somber tune sat on the shelf until it was leaked in recent years and made its own journey on TikTok. It’s Del Rey’s sixth top 10 appearance, and first solo U.K. top tier entry since “Born To Die” also hit No. 9 in 2012.
Eurovision 2023 is in the books, but a trio of songs from the annual song festival continue to fly high on the U.K. chart.
Following a record-setting week for Eurovision on the Official U.K. Chart, the 2023 champion, Sweden’s Loreen, sees her winning song “Tattoo” (UMG International) dip 2-4; Finland’s Käärijä’s “Cha Cha Cha” (WM Finland) down 6-15, and Great Britain rep Mae Muller’s “I Wrote A Song” (Capitol) down 9-18.
According to the Official Charts Company, “Tattoo” is the first Eurovision entry to spend two consecutive weeks in the U.K. Official Singles Chart top 5 in 27 years. The last to do so was Australia-born U.K. contestant Gina G’s “Ooh Ahh…Just A Little Bit,” which logged nine consecutive weeks in the top 5 back in 1996, including a one-week stint at No. 1.
Finally, Australia’s pop princess Kylie Minogue bags her 52nd U.K. top 40 with “Padam Padam” (BMG). The electro pop tune new at No. 26, on the chart, published May 26, for the Melbourne pop veteran’s highest-charting song in her adopted homeland since “Into The Blue” hit No. 12 back in 2014. “Padam Padam” is the most-downloaded song of the week in the U.K., for top spot on Official Singles Sales Chart and Download Chart.

title: Lana Del Rey curte praia de Ipanema após show no Rio de Janeiro
content:
Foto: Dilson Silva/ AgNews
A cantora norte-americana Lana Del Rey tem aproveitado ao máximo a estadia no Brasil. Após se apresentar no MITA Festival 2023, no Rio de Janeiro, show elogiado pelo público apesar do atraso, a intérprete de 'Born to Die' se jogou no mar.
Lana foi clicada na companhia de amigos curtindo a Praia de Ipanema, na cidade maravilhosa. A cantora chegou ao local de calça jeans e um body rendado em um tom bege. Para aproveitar o sol, a cantora tirou a calça e ficou apenas com o maiô, enquanto algumas amigas estavam de biquíni.

A performance foi transmitida pelo público que acompanhava pela TV com 30 minutos de atraso, um pedido da própria cantora. No repertório, hits como 'Young and Beautiful', 'Born to Die', 'Ride', 'Summertime Sadness' e 'Video Games'.
Eu estou TO-DO arrepiado com a plateia em Young and Beautiful 🤯 #LanaDelReyNoMultishow #MITANoMultishow pic.twitter.com/CHyuAqUyQI — Multishow (@multishow) May 28, 2023

title: Taylor Swift lança versão deluxe do Midnights, com faixa inédita; ouça
content:
Taylor Swift quer te acompanhar até o amanhecer com a nova versão deluxe de seu álbum mais recente: Midnights (The Till Dawn Edition) traz 23 faixas ao todo.
A tracklist inclui a inédita "Hits Different" e reimaginações de "Karma" (em parceria com Ice Spice) e "Snow on the Beach" (com participação expandida de Lana Del Rey).
Confira o álbum completo abaixo, pelo Spotify, ou escolha sua plataforma de preferência.
Lançado em outubro do ano passado, Midnights já rendeu os clipes "Lavender Haze", "Anti-Hero" e "Bejeweled" -- este último coestrelado por Laura Dern.
A cantora atualmente se apresenta pelos EUA com sua nova turnê, The Eras Tour. Embora não tenha datas confirmadas, há rumores de que Swift deve passar pelo Brasil com o show.
Enquanto isso, ela se prepara para o lançamento de mais uma regravação de um de seus discos antigos: Speak Now (Taylor's Version) deve sair em 7 de julho.

title: Taylor Swift Shares New Songs With Ice Spice and Lana Del Rey: Listen
content:
Taylor Swift’s new deluxe version of Midnights is out now. As previously reported, it comes with two new songs: a new remix of “Karma” with Ice Spice and an extended version “Snow on the Beach” featuring more contributions from Lana Del Rey.
According to Del Rey, Swift originally asked her to sing the entire second verse of the original version of “Snow on the Beach.” “My job as a feature on a big artist’s album is to make sure I help add to the production of the song, so I was more focused on the production,” she told Billboard. “She was very adamant that she wanted me to be on the album, and I really liked that song.”
Ice Spice has had a breakout year following the success of “Munch.” She recently shared “Boy’s a Liar Pt 2” with PinkPantheress; she’s also set to appear on the Barbie soundtrack alongside Nicki Minaj on “Barbie World.” Del Rey’s new album Did You Know That There’s a Tunnel Under Ocean Blvd came out earlier this year. Swift is still on her Eras Tour. She’s releasing Speak Now (Taylor’s Version) on July 7.

title: Taylor Swift announces 'Midnights' deluxe album with Ice Spice
content:
Singer Taylor Swift has something special in store for her fans. She has announced a new deluxe edition of her 'Midnights' album, titled 'Midnights: Til Dawn', that will feature Ice Spice as her guest on a fresh version of 'Karma' and additional, newly recorded lead vocals from Lana Del Rey on their 'Snow on the Beach' collaboration, Variety reported.
Digital and physical editions will each have a format-exclusive track. For the digital release, it will be "Hits Different," a song that was previously only available on the Target version of "Midnights." More interestingly for fans, the physical edition will have a "Vault" track never before heard from the "Midnights" writing sessions. Although Swift's announcement of the collaboration with Ice Spice made no mention of a music video, the image that she released to go along with the reveal strongly indicates that a video may already be in the can.
"SO much to tell you. I'm a massive fan of this brilliant artist and after getting to know her I can confirm: she is THE ONE to watch. So delighted to say that Karma Featuring the incredible @icespice will be out TOMORROW night at MIDNIGHT ET as a part of the new Midnights (Til Dawn Edition) deluxe album that you can pre-order now at store.taylorswift.com! In addition to Karma Ft Ice Spice... You asked for it, we listened: Lana and I went back into the studio specifically to record more Lana on Snow on the Beach. Love u @honeymoon," she posted on Instagram. Meanwhile, Ice Spice's popularity has exploded since she first shot to viral fame with "Munch (Feelin' U)" last fall. Her debut EP, Like..?, arrived in January on 10K Projects/Capitol, and Ice Spice proceeded to score top 10 smashes on the Hot 100 with the PinkPantheress team-up "Girl's a Liar Pt. 2" and the Nicki Minaj-assisted remix to her song "Princess Diana," Billboard reported. (ANI)
(This story has not been edited by Devdiscourse staff and is auto-generated from a syndicated feed.)

title: Taylor Swift Ice Spice Collab, Suga Breaks Record, J-Hope Army Update
content:
Taylor Swift reveals Ice Spice ‘Karma’ Remix and a different version of her Lana Del Rey collab. Stevie Nicks thanked Taylor for writing “You’re on Your Own, Kid,” which helped her mourn Christine McVie. Joe Jonas gave curious Swifties an update on his relationship with Swift on an episode of Dax Shepard’s ‘Armchair Expert’ podcast. As Blake Shelton says goodbye to ‘The Voice’, season 23 winning coach Niall Horan will return, and Reba McEntire joins the panel of judges. And more!
Tetris Kelly 0:00
Ice Spice is jumping on a Taylor Swift remix and so much other Swift news. Blake Shelton says goodbye to The Voice and Katy Perry wants Lizzo for ‘Idol’. BTS’ Suga breaks a major record and J-Hope is in the army. We get to know more about Lore and Goyo.
Tetris Kelly 0:18
Welcome back to Billboard News. I’m Tetris Kelly, and it’s Wednesday May 24. We’ve got to talk about my girl Taylor because so many other people are. Taylor gets Ice Spice on a track and gets a thank you from Stevie Nicks. And Joe Jonas updates us on how he, Tay and the Swifties are doing. Taylor jumped on socials to announce a remix of the ‘Midnights’ track ‘Karma’ featuring Ice Spice, noting, “I’m a massive fan of this brilliant artist and after getting to know her I can confirm she is the one to watch.” The track is out tomorrow along with a Till Dawn edition of ‘Midnights’ featuring more Lana Del Rey and a new track.
Stevie Nicks 0:55
Thank you to Taylor Swift for doing this for me — and that is writing a song called ‘You’re On Your Own Kid.’
Tetris Kelly 1:08
Stevie Nicks spoke at a concert on how Taylor’s ‘Midnights’ track ‘You’re On Your Own Kid’ helped her process the death of bandmate Christine McVie.
Stevie Nicks 1:17
When it was the two of us, the two of us were on our own, kids. We always were. And now I’m having to learn to be on my own kid by myself. So you helped me to do that.
Tetris Kelly 1:29
In other Tay news, Joe Jonas is talking about his relationship with the superstar and her fans after formerly dating her. “I’m cool with Taylor,” Jonas told Dax Shepard’s ‘Armchair Expert’ podcast. “We’re cool.” He added of her very loyal fanbase: “I hope to think they liked me. No one f***s with the Swifties, you know,”. Oh, I know Joe. I am one, and you’re cool with us. Now let’s talk about some music competition shows. ‘The Voice’ and ‘Idol’ just ended and their next seasons could look pretty different.
Carson Daly 2:02
The winner of season 23 of the voice is Gina Miles!
Tetris Kelly 2:07
Gina Miles may have won ‘The Voice’ for team Niall Horan and Iam Tongi may have won ‘American Idol,’ but it’s the judges’ panels that really have viewers talking.
Tetris Kelly 2:24
Blake Shelton said goodbye to ‘The Voice’ after 23 seasons with a heartfelt tribute with his mentors over the years, but who’s coming back next season? Season 23 winning coach Niall Horan is returning and will be joined by returning judges John Legend and Blake’s wife Gwen Stefani. Replacing Blake for 24 is country music legend Reba McEntire.
Reba McEntire 2:48
To be able to come in and form my team. I’m so looking forward to it.
Tetris Kelly 2:54
Over on ‘American Idol’ Katy Perry would love to shake things up on the judges panel because it comes with its challenges
Katy Perry 3:01
Probably being a woman and having a strong opinion.
Tetris Kelly 3:03
But she has a solution for the testosterone overload.
Katy Perry 3:06
This is an invitation from me, Katy Perry: Lizzo, I’m asking you to join the panel. I could really use some bold, honest hot takes.
Tetris Kelly 3:16
She told BuzzFeed she would love to share judging duties with Lizzo. Onto the story that has the Internet divided: BTS is used to breaking records, but this time it’s being challenged. J-Hope says “Hi” from the army and SUGA breaks touring records. Here’s today’s BTS news. After unleashing his solo album ‘Jack in the Box’ and a hot collab with J. Cole, BTS’ J-Hope has entered his mandatory military service in South Korea. He shared pics that the ARMY are dying over and a caption saying, “ARMYs I finished it well. I was able to complete training well because of the letters of support you sent me were very helpful. Will do my best for the rest of my military service and show you my best. I love you.” We love you too. And ARMY also showed a lot of love to SUGA. Under his Agust D persona, it’s being reported that he’s the first rapper to earn over $3 million in a single arena concert in US history. He joins the likes of Lizzo and Travis Scott, as Twitter continues its reoccurring debate on who it considers to be a rapper.
Tetris Kelly 4:23
From K-pop to K-rock. I caught up with LØREN back in Austin and played a little rapid fire game to learn a little more about the rocker
Tetris Kelly 4;38
I do want to play a game with you, it’d be really easy. I’m just going to say a sentence and you finish it with the first thought that comes to your head as quick as possible. Alright?
LØREN 4:45
Alright.
Tetris Kelly 4:45
My favorite late night snack is
LØREN 4:47
Instant noodles.
Tetris Kelly 4:48
Instant noodles?!
LØREN 4:49
It’s like in my blood, you know? Like, it’s like the one thing that you’re not supposed to eat at night.
Tetris Kelly 4:54
If I wasn’t a singer, I would be…
LØREN 4:56
A tattooist.
Tetris Kelly 4:57
Have you ever done one of your own tattoos?
LØREN 5:00
I actually have a really close tattooist, and you know I give her like a really bad picture of what I want and she just kind of like refines it you know? And so we kind of go back and forth and she’s like, What do you think about this angle? What do you think about the size? And then we just kind of put it together.
Tetris Kelly 5:13
The most famous person that follows me on IG is…
LØREN 5:16
I think Somi from the Black Label. I think
LØREN 5:26
I’m pretty sure that’s it.
Tetris Kelly 5:27
I’m gonna go through your followers now.
Tetris Kelly 5:29
My current obsession is,
LØREN 5:31
I think cars I’ve always been a car guy and I don’t think I ever grew out of it but I recently got into a car crash and so I need to get like a rental right so I got a Toyota Supra and that car’s been like really really fun so I think just going for drives has been my obsession.
Tetris Kelly 5:45
Well, thanks so much for again for coming out and hanging out. This is so fun.
Tetris Kelly 5:54
Before I let you go, Goyo is killing the Latin music game and if you don’t know her here’s five things about the artist.
Goyo 6:01
¡Hola, mi gente! Soy Goyo La Pantera y estas son cinco cosas que no sabían de mí. Primera cosa que no sabías de mí: Bueno, amo las pastas, me encanta la comida Italiana. Nadie se espera eso de mí, pero me gusta todo lo italiano, hasta Mario Bros. Segunda cosa que no sabías de mí: Seguramente no sabían que ya no vivo en Colombia, que estoy viviendo en Miami. Tercera cosa que no saben de mí: Que pertenezco a un grupo que se llama ChocQuibTown, pero que estoy haciendo un álbum, construyendo un álbum, sola, con todo el mundo de La Pantera, pa’ ustedes, mi combo, con mucho amor. Cuarta cosa que no sabían de mí: Que antes de ser Goyo y estar en ChocQuibTown, estuve en un colectivo que se llama Sidestepper, dirigido por Richard Blair, un productor Inglés y que con ellos pude viajar por 25 países en el mundo, en muchos festivales, rapeando y cantando con ellos. Y quinta cosa que no sabían de mí, es que practiqué por mucho tiempo voleibol y estuve en el equipo del colegio, y todavía me encanta, así que en estos días nos vemos en una cancha en Miami Beach.
Tetris Kelly 7:27
That’s it for today. Come back tomorrow for my interview with Lauren Jauregui and we talk about one of my favorite topics Disney. I’m Tetris Kelly and this is Billboard News.

title: Taylor Swift Announces Midnights Vault Track & Ice Spice Collab
content:
Watch : Taylor Swift Says She's Never Been Happier 1 Month After Joe Alwyn Split
As Taylor Swift sings, two is better than one.
And now, the 12-time Grammy winner is collaborating with another artist for a remix of her Midnights hit "Karma." No need to guess who is filling in the blank space as Taylor recently revealed that Ice Spice will be The 1 featured on the track.
"Um. SO much to tell you," Taylor wrote on Instagram May 24. "I'm a massive fan of this brilliant artist and after getting to know her I can confirm: she is THE ONE to watch."
While fans aren't out of the woods just yet in terms of having to wait for the song to drop, the countdown won't be much longer. In fact, Taylor said she's "so delighted" to announce that "Karma" featuring the "incredible" Ice Spice will drop May 26 at, of course, midnight as part of the Midnights (Til Dawn Edition) deluxe album.
And she isn't the only one excited about the release.
"Karma ft me tmm night," Ice Spice wrote in a separate Instagram post. "thxx @taylorswift for being the coolest person on earth ilu 5/26."

title: Taylor Swift, Ice Spice Remixed Karma for Midnights Til Dawn
content:
Photo-Illustration: Vulture. Photos: Getty Images
Swifties still have to wait over a month for Speak Now (Taylor’s Version), but Taylor Swift is giving her fans something else to munch on in the meantime. That is, a remix of “Karma” with up-and-coming drill-pop rapper Ice Spice. “I’m a massive fan of this brilliant artist and after getting to know her I can confirm: she is THE ONE to watch,” Swift wrote on social media. Ice Spice confirmed the news with love on Twitter: “sweetest person ever thank u sm 😍💜 i love yuuuu.” The remix is part of a new Midnights (Til Dawn Edition), out May 26 on midnight. And that’s not it — Swift is also releasing a new version of “Snow on the Beach” with a bit more Lana after fans’ jokes about the Midnights track. “You asked for it, we listened,” Swift wrote. The Til Dawn Edition also features “Hits Different,” the Target exclusive track for Midnights, on streaming platforms for the first time. In addition to being available for preorder, the Til Dawn Edition will also be for sale at Swift’s New Jersey shows this weekend as a special physical edition including the “vault” track “You’re Losing Me.”
The Ice Spice remix is Swift’s first hip-hop collaboration since Reputation, when she worked with Future on the song “End Game.” And it could be a bit of karma after Swift’s rumored new boyfriend, the 1975’s Matty Healy, was part of a racist discussion about Ice Spice on a recent podcast appearance. Healy apologized to Ice Spice at a 1975 show in Auckland, New Zealand, last month. “It’s not because I’m annoyed that me joking got misconstrued,” he told the crowd. “It’s because I don’t want Ice Spice to think I’m a dick. I love you, Ice Spice. I’m so sorry.” Just remember who Taylor’s real boyfriend is.

title: Lana Del Rey Shares New Song “Say Yes to Heaven”: Listen
content:
Lana Del Rey has released the long-circulated loosie “Say Yes to Heaven.” According to a press release, she co-wrote the song with Rick Nowels in 2012. Its release comes after a leaked version gained prominence online. Listen to the new song, along with a sped-up version, below.
“Say Yes to Heaven” is now Del Rey’s first single since dropping Did You Know That There’s a Tunnel Under Ocean Blvd in March. Since then, she’s released a video for “Candy Necklace” with its guest vocalist, Jon Batiste, in which she portrays Hollywood icons like Marilyn Monroe. That was the first video from the album, though the singles “A&W,” “The Grants,” and the title track preceded it.

title: "The Marvelous Mrs. Maisel" and the rise of the nepo parent
content:
The ethereal piano. The sweeping, memorable melody which feels both timeless and bittersweet. We could be in a Lana Del Rey song. But we're not. We're listening to a track by her father, pianist and composer Robert Grant (Del Rey's birth name is Elizabeth Woolridge Grant). The song, from his upcoming album "Lost at Sea," due out June 9, is music only, but one could easily imagine Del Rey's nostalgic vocals drifting over the keys (and they will, on several tracks). "The talent really runs in the family," reads one comment on a YouTube video of another song.
It's almost like … it's really hard to break into the arts and having a famous, wealthy and industry-established family helps.
Grant senior has become the latest to claim nepo parent fame (something he jokes openly about to the point of merchandise). Late last year, prompted by a New York Magazine cover story, the phrase "nepo baby" entered the cultural bloodstream. Referring to the adult child of famous parents, helped along by their family's showbiz connections, associations and wealth, the internet was suddenly full of examples of celebrities who had ridden that nepotism wave. Gracie Abrams? J.J. Abrams' daughter. Dakota Johnson? The child of Melanie Griffith and Don Johnson. Timothée Chalamet? His mother is Broadway star Nicole Flender, father is filmmaker Rodman Flender and grandfather was screenwriter Harold Flender. It's almost like . . . it's really hard to break into the arts and having a famous, wealthy and industry-established family helps.
The nepo parent trend flips the idea. The kid is the one who has made it. And now their older, often retired parent or parents are coming along. And as with Grant, a white-haired former real estate broker and CEO who now is a deep sea fisherman, the trend is looked upon lovingly. It's sweet that the album cover of "Lost at Sea" recalls Del Rey's 2019 "Norman F****ing Rockwell!" with a figure standing on a boat. On "Late Night with Seth Myers," actor Ike Barinholtz joked affectionately about his nepo dad, Alan Barinholtz, a former lawyer and latent aspiring actor, "He's a new ingenue in Los Angeles. And his name is my dad."
But when nepo parents come to "The Marvelous Mrs. Maisel," they come with a whole host of other issues involving pressure and expectation. Even though the roles are reversed, it's something else for Midge (Rachel Brosnahan) to handle, to manage both the emotions and career of her mother.
In its fifth and final season on Prime Video, "Maisel," has treated us to a series of flash-forwards through time, designed to let us know where the characters end up, many years later. "Maisel" is no "Quantum Leap" and these time jumps are not always satisfying or sensible in the context of the long-established characters. Joel (Michael Zegen) goes to jail, for example, largely to protect his ex-wife Midge. Alex Borstein's Susie becomes a pothead, for some reason. And Midge's mother Rose (Marin Hinkle) is a matchmaker, still, many years on.
Marin Hinkle (Rose Weissman) in "The Marvelous Mrs. Maisel" (Prime Video)Her rise to matchmaking, as detailed in multiple seasons, has been a bit rocky. She was threatened by the mafia of established matchmakers (including a lovely turn by the wonderful Kelly Bishop). They threatened her husband Abe too, and burned down a beloved tea room in retribution. But Rose is good at finding love for clients — and managing their parents — and she persists.
In the future "Maisel" shows us, something has gone wrong. Or at least, gotten expensive. It's 1973, and Rose, in a Cher-type gauzy Mumu ensemble and flowers in her hair bigger than her head, is trying to star in a commercial for her matchmaking business. She's going regional and getting TV ads, baby. But it's not easy or natural for her. Midge assures her that the crew's complaining is "completely normal." Midge does a lot of reassuring.
Rachel Brosnahan (Miriam 'Midge' Maisel), Marin Hinkle (Rose Weissman) and Caroline Aaron (Shirley Maisel) in "The Marvelous Mrs. Maisel" (Prime Video)
Although it's not the child capitalizing on the parents' success, it is the child trying desperately to keep their parent happy.
On many levels, the nepo parent phenomenon makes sense. Artistic ability is sometimes inherited, often modeled and when an older parent starts doing the thing that their child loves, it's the ultimate taking an interest in their children's lives. Barinholtz describes the nepo parent as "a good thing . . . Everyone likes a nepo dad." We love a late bloomer, like Annette Badland of "Ted Lasso" or even Jennifer Coolidge.
With "Maisel," the nepotism is more adjacent than, for example, Catherine Scorsese becoming an actor after being cast by her son Martin Scorsese. But Midge is still using her connections to give her mother access, possibly (as the flashforward to the '70s shows us) after Rose has stopped being really good or completely invested in what she does. "You wanted this, remember," Midge tells her mother. And although it's not the child capitalizing on the parents' success, it is the child trying desperately to keep their parent happy. It's still pressure, as Midge stands behind the camera the whole time so Rose can look and say her lines to her, which seems like something Mama Rose might do.
Want a daily wrap-up of all the news and commentary Salon has to offer? Subscribe to our morning newsletter, Crash Course.
As the departure of housekeeper, cook, nanny and all-around apartment manager Zelda (Matilda Szydagis) proves, Rose has never been great about being grown-up. She doesn't understand what a linen closet is or how to turn on a vacuum (in her defense, Midge and Tony Shalhoub's Abe don't either). Rose's best season was when she went to Paris, leaving behind her husband with his learned helplessness and grandchildren in order to find herself, to latently be actualized. And it feels like she never really recovered from being pulled away from there, and the satisfying, simple life she had carved out for herself. In the future, she looks like a caricature of herself in the matchmaking commercial, propped up by her famous daughter, and that's a sad ending for such a complex and once independent character.

title: Lana Del Rey lança clipe de Candy Necklace com referências de Hollywood
content:
Mais um clipe do disco Did You Know That There’s A Tunnel Under Ocean Blvd foi liberado para o público! Nesta quarta-feira (10/5), Lana Del Rey divulgou o vídeo de Candy Necklace, sua parceria com Jon Batiste, que se destaca como o quarto single de seu nono álbum de estúdio.
Filmadas em Los Angeles, as imagens mostram Lana caracterizada como estrelas de Hollywood, como Marilyn Monroe e Elizabeth Short, conhecida como Black Dahlia. Já Batiste aparece em diferentes cenas interagindo e tocando piano ao lado da cantora.
Com direção de Rich Lee, o vídeo em preto e branco traz referências dos bastidores de gravações de cinema durante cerca de 10 minutos. Além disso, as imagens também contam com o processo de criação do próprio clipe, mostrando conversas da produção com a cantora.

title: Lana Del Rey Takes Puff Of Fan's Vape At Dublin Show
content:
Lana Del Rey was seen smoking a fan's vape during her show at Dublin's 3Arena on Friday.
The Norman F******g Rockwell singer was performing in the capital on Friday after announcing the gig just a week and a half prior, with tickets selling out in minutes.
Today's top videos STORY CONTINUES BELOW
Lana has been known to vape during her shows -- including one infamous incident where she stopped a show so she could find her lost vape -- and one person at the barrier managed to give her a hand just in case she didn't have one on her.
I gave Lana my vape tonight in Dublin 😭 queen was looking sick and like she needed a puff pic.twitter.com/MFA8Jx4z7R — Neil 🦊 (@bruthaniall) July 7, 2023
Lana fan Neil was in front row at the show, and once Lana came down to greet her fans, he offered her a hit of his disposable vape, with her immediately taking a hit.
The clip went viral on Twitter, with Neil tweeting 'I gave Lana my vape tonight in Dublin, queen was looking sick and like she needed a puff.'
Lost Mary in hand, Lana took a hit of the vape with pleasure -- only realising that it probably wasn't the best idea in front of over 10,000 people. Pic: Neil/Twitter
Other fans thought the clip was hilarious, with one person surprised at how quickly she took the vape -- while another added 'HELP she took the biggest puff ever.'
Others joked that Neil needed to sell the vape on eBay now, while one person suggested something more creative, tweeting 'The way i’d never use it again and place it in a glass container on display on my bookshelf for years to come.'

title: Lana Del Rey in Dublin: ‘I’m sorry I didn’t give you enough notice’
content:
Lana Del Rey
3Arena, Dublin
★★★★★
Lana Del Rey walks on stage looking like a character from an old Hollywood movie or from an All-American fashion line going through a gloomy phase: Ralph Lauren with a splash of gothic.
“They told me this was the land of the fairies and good luck,” she declares late in a rapturous concert. “I’m sorry I didn’t give you enough notice.”
She refers to her decision to announce an Irish show just 10 days’ ahead of time. It’s Taylor Swift syndrome in reverse. Half of Ireland is in a flap over getting tickets to Swift’s Aviva residency next summer.
Meanwhile, Del Rey has slipped in practically under the radar with a guerrilla gig in the country’s largest indoor venue.
READ MORE
Lana Del Rey performs at 3Arena, Dublin. Photo: Tom Honan for The Irish Times.
Not that there is anything under-rehearsed about either Del Rey or the audience. An ecstatic performance doubles as full-throttle love-in. The crowd belts aloud the lyrics even to the B-sides (especially to the B-sides perhaps). Del Rey, doing her bit, soaks up the love in a state of humble elation.
The music never feels like an afterthought. Del Rey emerges dressed like a high-concept version of Linda Gray in Dallas or a grimdark Dolly Parton – an American icon with just a hint of decadence. Her dress glimmers with sequins. Her hair, to quote her hit Summertime Sadness, is “done up ... real big, beauty queen style”.
With the volume in the room already cranked up to “ear-splitting shriek”, she opens with A&W. It’s a brooding highlight from her latest album, Do You Know There’s A Tunnel Under Ocean Blvd? Produced by Taylor Swift regular Jack Antonoff, the tune grapples with themes that recur throughout her repertoire: wild, unhinged obsession and physical passion used to fill in the blanks where true love should be.
Del Rey specialises in stately ballads, which somehow never tip into hairdryer belters – she is, in the very best sense, the anti-Adele. But with much of the evening proceeding in a stately shuffle, she feels there is a requirement to liven up the set – to put on both a visual and musical spectacle.
To that end, she is flanked by a swirl of vocalists and backing dancers. Their task is to bring melodrama to music which is already gloriously baroque. They fan around her as she swoons on Pretty When You Cry, from arguably her best album, Ultraviolence.
Lana Del Rey at the 3Arena. Photograph: Tom Honan/The Irish Times
Later, two of her ensemble waft back and on swings during Ride – a bonus cut from her debut LP Born To Die, which has grown into an anthem even as it circles such grim subjects as alcoholism and intergenerational trauma.
Del Rey comes to Ireland a fortnight after her late arrival at the Glastonbury festival led to the organisers pulling the plug with one song left. In Dublin, she’s just a few minutes later than advertised, the concert a gripping celebration of her decade as a cult mega-star and her intense relationship with her audience.
There is some banter – she talks about how moved she was by all the fans she has met in Ireland (she was in Temple Bar that morning giving out tickets to the show). She also plunges into the front row for a Princess Diana style ropewalk, posing for selfies and accepting bouquets (and then quietly chugs her vape as she returns to the stage).
The conclusion is glorious too. After the David Lynch fever-dream of Summertime Sadness, Del Rey brings out her breakthrough hit, Video Games, delivering the chorus from one of those swings. Higher and higher she soars. The crowd, singing along, soars higher yet, joining this melancholic cheerleader in her bruised rhapsody in red, white and blue.
A wave of smartphones capture the gig. Photograph: Tom Honan/The Irish Times
Lana Del Rey takes a seat during her set. Photograph: Tom Honan/The Irish Times
Lana Del Rey in Dublin. Photograph: Tom Honan/The Irish Times

title: What time is Lana Del Rey on stage for BST Hyde Park?
content:
L ana Del Rey has announced her support acts for when she will headline BST Hyde Park on Sunday July 9.
With just days to spare, fans had worried that the lack of a support bill might mean the enigmatic singer-songwriter would pull out. But she has now confirmed her collaborators Father John Misty and Gang of Youths will be the primary warm-up before she takes to the Great Oak Stage.
After her top-billed performance on Glastonbury’s Other Stage was beset by technical issues, fans will be hoping the rare chance to see her perform in the UK will be free of hitches.
She will be the last of the British Summer Time headliners to perform – following sets from Pink, Gwen Stefani, Bruce Springsteen, Billy Joel, Blackpink and Guns N’ Roses.
The US singer earlier this year released her ninth album, Did You Know There’s a Tunnel Under Ocean Boulevard?
Fans can expect songs from the LP as well as favourites from previous records, judging by her setlists from her summer of touring festivals worldwide.
Other acts include The Last Dinner Party, SYML, Riopy, Tommy Genesis, Holly Macve, Etta Marcus, Kings Elliot and Siights. Several of those names also featured on Did You Know There’s a Tunnel Under Ocean Boulevard?
Tickets are sold out except for the final few Great Oak Premium VIP seats. For those lucky enough to have tickets, here is what you need to know.
What time will Lana Del Rey be on stage?
Priority entry is at 1pm and general entry 2pm, with last entry at 8.30pm.
BST organisers have yet to confirm when Lana Del Rey or the support will be on stage.
However, when timings are revealed, fans will know to take them with a pinch of salt, especially given Del Rey was half an hour late to her set at Glastonbury.
So far, most of the acts have been on stage before 9pm.
There is a 10.30pm curfew and the show will be over by then, whether Del Rey has got through her setlist or not.
Lana Del Rey Gun ... singer's cheeky homage to Axl Rose at London gig 1 / 2 Lana Del Rey Gun ... singer's cheeky homage to Axl Rose at London gig lana2.jpg On song: Lana Del Rey performs at the Jazz Cafe lana.jpg Homage? The singer has been linked to Guns 'N Roses frontman Axl Rose
What will Lana Del Rey’s setlist be?
Glastonbury fans will never know how the final quarter of her set would have sounded but the singer has been consistent in what she has played at previous festivals.

title: Lana Del Rey Enjoys A Spot Of Shopping In Temple Bar
content:
US superstar Lana Del Rey was spotted out and about in Dublin this week ahead of her sold-out 3Arena show on Friday.
The Video Games singer delighted fans in Temple Bar vintage shop Nine Crows, stopping in to browse the selection and even offering them tickets to her gig.
Today's top videos STORY CONTINUES BELOW
Lana announced an impromptu Dublin gig last month as part of her ongoing European tour, with Irish fans scrambling for the coveted tickets.
Influencer and Nine Crows employee Alex Morgan took to Instagram on Thursday to share her delight at rubbing shoulders with the songstress.
'I met Lana Del Ray earlier. Still shaking. What a gorgeous soul,' Alex excitedly wrote.
Alex shared a sweet snap of her and four of her fellow employees smiling alongside the singer, right before she invited them to the highly-anticipated gig.
The Video Games singer delighted fans in Temple Bar vintage shop Nine Crows, stopping in to browse the selection and even offering them tickets to her gig. Pic: David Wolff - Patrick/Getty Images
The superstar took to the stage at the 3Arena on Friday, July 7, in what will be one of the biggest concerts of the year.
Following on from scheduling issues at her landmark Glastonbury performance, the singer announced three new additions to her European tour in Amsterdam, Dublin and Paris.

title: Madison Beer Reacts to Lana Del Rey Shout-Out, Talks Upcoming Album
content:
Madison Beer reacts to Lana Del Rey giving her a shout-out on the red carpet of Billboard’s 2023 Women In Music, reflects about growing up in the music industry in her new memoir, talks about her upcoming new album ‘Silence Between Songs’ and more.
Madison Beer
It’s like what kills you make you stronger? Like I didn’t need to be stronger. I needed to be a kid. Hey guys, it’s Madison Beer and you are watching Billboard News.
Rania Aniftos
Hey everybody, it’s Rania Aniftos with Billboard News, and I’m here with the wonderful singer, songwriter, author Madison Beer.
Rania Aniftos
You have an exciting year, you just announced your album ‘Silence Between Songs.’ And I would love to know the inspiration behind the song title because it seems metaphorical.
Madison Beer
Yeah, definitely is. I think that to summarize it sort of simply, I kind of have always been a person, you know, I got sort of really, really young doing this. And I feel like I’ve had a very busy 12 years or so in this industry. And I kind of convinced myself that, you know, the moments where I was making music, and I was on tour. And I was, you know, my busiest was actually when I was growing. But as I’ve gotten a little older, I’ve realized that it’s actually been the moments that I’ve been able to tune out the noise and I’ve been able to be alone and really reflect and like, you know, be more isolated that I’ve actually grown the most. So. So yeah, it’s been sort of the silence between songs, when the noises turned out that I feel like I’ve learned to I am the most.
Watch the full interview above!

title: Lana Del Rey in Ireland: Stage times, doors, setlist
content:
(via Getty Images)
Lana last performed in Ireland in 2019.
Lana Del Rey is coming to Dublin's 3Arena this Friday, 7th of July.
The singer announced a surprise gig just last week in Dublin, Amsterdam and Paris.
Lana said: "I love Europe and after playing Glastonbury, have decided to play a few more shows in various countries around my Hyde Park Show in London on July 9."
Last time, Lana Del Rey last performed in Dublin in 2019 at Malahide Castle.
Check out everything you need to know before the gig.
Stage times
Doors open at 6:30pm. Lana will be on stage between 8pm and 9pm.
Public transport
The 3Arena is very well served by public transport. The Luas Red Line will drop you right at the door and also serves Heuston and Connolly stations.
Dublin Bus also offers a number of bus routes. The 151 route runs every 10 minutes during rush hour.
Set list
The rumoured setlist that may be similar to her recent shows looks like this:
A&W
Young and Beautiful
Bartender
Chemtrails Over the Country Club
The Grants
Cherry
Pretty When You Cry
Ride
Born To Die
Blue Jeans
Norman Fucking Rockwell
Arcadia
Ultraviolence
White Mustang
Candy Necklace
Venice Bitch
Diet Mountain Dew
Summertime Sadness
Did You Know That There's A Tunnel Under Ocean Blvd
Video Games
Tickets
The concert is sold out but keep an eye on Ticketmaster for a chance to grad a ticket from someone reselling.

title: Lana Del Rey: our greatest millennial troubadour’s secret to success
content:
W hen you find yourself in the snow globe world of Lana Del Rey you immediately realise you couldn’t be anywhere else. The pink-sunset desert vista is sepia-tinted and slightly solarised, the smell a mixture of bougainvillea and weed, the whole thing seen through the lens of David Lynch or Kourtney Roy. There are hints of the past, plenty of West Coast pop-cultural references, and a veneer of perennially doomed relationships.
It is VERY Lana.
She remains our greatest millennial troubadour, whose songs are saturated in Americana. Cinematic, melancholic and deliberately transgressive, she uses California’s tarnished dreams as a metaphor for her own, and vice versa. She mixes romance and dread like no one since Lou Reed. Sometimes it’s a bit gloopy, but basically it’s pretty damn good.
And her Hyde Park concert this weekend is one of the most hotly anticipated of the year.
Fresh from a confusing performance at Glastonbury, this week she brings her tortured beauty queen persona (detached yet sincere, coy but deadly) to London. Her last appearance here was six years ago at a one-off performance at the Academy in Brixton, a massively oversubscribed gig which sold out in minutes. As she attracts the kind of super fans who don’t brook criticism, the show was more like a rally than a concert. She generated the kind of adulation not seen since Beatlemania.
Lana Del Rey at the 2023 Billboard Women in Music awards in March / AFP via Getty Images
With velvet green curtains draped from the top of the stage, as well as a smattering of trees and glitzy podiums, the set looked like one of those photographs of disused petrol stations in the Midwest that are so popular with art photographers these days. You know, Twin Peaks seen through the eyes of Wes Anderson. In Brixton she played just 14 songs, a kind of greatest hits setlist including Video Games, Blue Jeans and Summertime Sadness.
This new London date promises to be spectacular, not least because it gives her the opportunity to showcase her recent material, and in particular the classic set of songs on her 2019 album Norman F***ing Rockwell! as well as this year’s almost-as-good Did You Know That There Is a Tunnel Under Ocean Blvd. Her previous two tours were not brought to the UK, meaning that she has not toured here since her Paradise tour 10 years ago.
In Lana Del Rey world you can cover a lot of neon-lit backstreets in a decade, a lot of California scrub, and a hell of a lot of West Coast freeway. In that time, she has spun new icons out of old, playing with imagery, tropes and touchstones of the past and separating them from their original context in such a way as to completely reinvent them.
A critic in the New Yorker said that her work is becoming more personal, if not necessarily autobiographical; this isn’t as crass as it sounds and is perhaps an example of just how successful her alter ego has become at maturing. She might still be tragi-glam, but it’s the kind of kohl-eyed style that only works if you’ve got the energy and the talent to sustain it.
She is revered by musicians from the generation before hers: Stevie Nicks, who appeared on Del Rey’s 2017 Lust for Life; Cat Power, who’s covered her White Mustang; and Courtney Love, who recently said that Del Rey and Kurt Cobain are “the only two true musical geniuses I’ve ever known.”
Elizabeth Woolridge Grant’s decision to pursue her career using a stage name is no more complicated than Bob Dylan’s. Robert Zimmerman may have taken a little longer to become famous, while white-bread East Coast boarding-school alum Grant obviously felt that Lana Del Rey had more of an enigmatic feel to it. Is her angsty rebellion simply a kind of sullen glamour? Is her low-fi chamber pop just the pivot of an anxious generation, or is it more than that? Some have said that she increasingly paws for happiness in a world more hardened than the one in which her star rose, although maybe she’s just better now at impersonating how she feels.
Promotional of Lana Del Rey shot from 2021 / Handout
“With past stuff, I would talk about the garden of evil and good and bad, but I really was meeting some characters,” she told Billie Eilish earlier in the year. “Like they used to say, ‘When girls got to Hollywood, they were fresh off the boat’. I didn’t hear that term until later, but I did meet some people that I thought were really cool who were like, ‘Do you want to go to the Guns N’ Roses concert?’ And I would be like, ‘Yeah.’ Then, somehow, I would be sitting in a garden and I would see David Lynch behind a red curtain with a cigarette.
“I got to LA I was mostly touring. I didn’t know that many people. I had a lot of random experiences that I wrote about, and at the time, they made me really happy because I was like, ‘I’m not just watching someone else live their life, I’m living my life,’ which was new for me because I’ve always been so shy. I think the storytelling vibe that people get is because I was just in awe of the things that were going on. Coming from a farming town, LA was never a possibility. My brother and sister and I always say, every time we drive through a perfectly symmetrical palm tree lane, we feel like we’re on a set. Maybe it was my lens on how heightened everything felt.”
When her spaceship lands in Hyde Park at the weekend, she will no doubt be greeted with a kind of blind appreciation, but after her disastrous Glastonbury performance a few weeks ago the press will not be so forgiving. Being half an hour late, blaming your hairdresser and misunderstanding the curfew didn’t endear her to anyone who waited for her on the Other Stage. Especially as she didn’t have enough time to play her signature hit, Video Games.
However, for some her appearance on Sunday will be the closest they come to a religious experience this year, a physical manifestation of a character who has spent much of her career amplifying a weird hinterland.
Let’s see.
Lana Del Rey plays BST Hyde Park on July 9; bst-hydepark.com

title: BST Hyde Park updates fans amid Lana Del Rey 'cancellation' rumours
content:
Love Glastonbury? From tickets to headliners, sign up here for the latest updates from Worthy Farm
BST Hyde Park festival-goers have been given an update about headlining act Lana Del Rey as rumours circulated that she might have her set cancelled. Over the last few days, many fans have speculated the American songstress won't be taking to the stage at this year's event due to minimal announcements about her support acts.
Several comments on BST Hyde Park's latest Instagram post come from music fans complaining at the lack of updates regarding the acts that are meant to perform this Sunday (July 9). Francesborrie commented: "At this point it’s either cancelled or I’m going to be opening for Lana."
Chlopiecy added: "You guys left me on read! Where is the line-up? The show is in 6 days." Xshaye.s said: "If you cancel Lana's show, I will cancel myself. you will be to blame. kisses." Charlotttereid fumed: "I have not given you 130 great British pounds for you to act like this."
Sigrnm wrote: "Please Lana!! I've payed 600 pounds to fly to London from Norway to see her, been my dream since i was 14 and now in really started to worry that she's cancelled pls give us a peace of mind." Marielouise said: "You could at least just do a story saying that the Lana support acts are announced soon to provide peace of mind."
However, one of our sister publications, MyLondon, has received information about the event fans have been desperately waiting for. After reaching out to BST Hyde Park about the rumours, festival organisers assured the gig is still going ahead and the support acts will be announced this week.
A spokesperson said: "This is going ahead and supports will be announced." Lana Del Rey's manager Ben Mawson also gave reassurance to fans by taking to his Instagram story last night to write: "Excited 4 Sunday @ Hyde Park. Support acts announced soon."
It comes after Lana Del Rey caused quite a stir at Glastonbury Festival last month by arriving on stage late and having her set cut short and her microphone cut off due to running over the allotted time limit.
Thousands turned up to watch her headline the Other Stage on Saturday (June 24), but many were left frustrated as the 38-year-old was 30 minutes late. The Blue Jeans singer was scheduled to perform at 10.30pm, but didn't arrive until 11pm.
She explained to the crowd that her tardiness was due to her hair taking to long to do. Grovelling to festival-goers as she appeared on stage, she said: "I'm so f*****g late that I am about to rush this set today.
"If they cut power, they cut power. I'm super f*****g sorry, my hair takes so long to do. I love you all. Let's keep on running the set as it's supposed to go."

title: Jon Batiste New Album Featuring Lana Del Rey, Lil Wayne & More Collabs
content:
Just two years after releasing his Grammy-winning album We Are, cross-genre savant Jon Batiste is gearing up to unleash his next record upon the world. On Wednesday, (June 28), the multi-hyphenate took to Twitter to reveal that his new studio album, titled World Music Radio, is slated for an Aug. 18 release — and will feature collaborations with Lana Del Rey, Lil Wayne, Kenny G and more.
“World Music Radio is a concept album that takes place in the interstellar regions of the universe,” Batiste wrote on Twitter. “The listener is led through the album by an interstellar traveling griot named Billy Bob Bo Bob, who takes you sonically all around the world at the speed of light.”
Alongside his announcement of the album’s title and release date, Batiste also debuted the official visualizer for the set’s lead single, “Calling Your Name.” “I created this album with a feeling of liberation in my life and a renewed sense of exploration of my personhood, my craft and of the world around me unlike anything I had ever felt before,” mused Batiste.
In addition to Del Rey, Lil Wayne, and Kenny G, the album will also feature collaborations with Jon Bellion, Fireboy DML, J.I.D., NewJeans and more. World Music Radio — which is executive produced by Batiste, Bellion and Ryan Lynn — is certainly a star-studded affair. According to the press release, Batiste’s purpose for the new album is to explore the idea that all music is “world music,” and forge an international, cross-cultural community through different kinds of popular music from different regions around the world.
Two years ago, Batiste made history as the first Black artist to win the Grammy for Album of the Year in 14 years when he triumphed in the category for his genre-spanning We Are. He won four other awards that night, adding a handful of trophies to a mantle that already boasts an Academy Award for Best Original Score thanks to his work on 2020’s Soul alongside Trent Reznor and Atticus Ross of Nine Inch Nails.
Batiste has landed two titles on the Billboard 200: 2014’s Social Music (No. 134, as Jon Batiste & Stay Human) and 2021’s We Are (No. 25).
See his World Music Radio announcement and listen to “Calling Your Name” below.

title: Jon Batiste's 'World Music Radio' Will Include Lana Del Rey, Lil Wayne
content:
The 2024 Grammy race may have just gotten a shakeup. Jon Batiste, who dominated the 2022 awards with his breakout album “We Are,” has announced a followup, “World Music Radio,” set to come out Aug. 18 on Verve/Interscope.
Among the guests on the album is Lana Del Rey, returning the favor from Batiste’s recent appearance on two tracks on her “Did You Know There’s a Tunnel Under Ocean Blvd” release earlier this year. Their collaboration, “Life Lesson,” is listed as a bonus track wrapping up the 21-song release, but is likely to be the most anticipated track, however it’s billed.
Other guests include Lil Wayne on “Uneasy,” Kenny G on “Clair De Lune,” Native Soul on “Raindance,” Leigh-Anne on “Running Away,” Jon Bellion and Fireboy DML on “Drink Water,” Rita Payés on “My Heart,” Heroes on “Movement 18′” and Michael Batiste on “Call Now (504-305-8269).”
On Wednesday morning Batiste also released the first single from the album, “Calling Your Name.” This may not represent his ultimate major play for record of the year honors, seeing as it clocks in at a blink-and-you’ll-miss-it one minute and 57 seconds.
“I created this album with a feeling of liberation in my life and a renewed sense of exploration of my personhood, my craft and of the world around me unlike anything I had ever felt before,” Batiste said in a statement accompanying the release news.
One of the songs, “Be Who You Are,” was already released this month as part of a Coke promotion.
Befitting his interest in crossover, the Interscope imprint is a new one for Batiste, as his last release was solely attributed to the traditionally jazz- and singer-songwriter-oriented Verve label.
Batiste, the former television band leader for Stephen Colbert, shocked Grammy prognosticators when the “We Are” album picked up 14 nominations in seven categories in 2021 and went on to win five trophies the following year, including record of the year. Those honors came atop the best original score Oscar he collected alongside Trent Reznor and Atticus Ross for his work on Pixar’s “Soul” in 2020.
“World Music Radio” is being released as a double-LP, among other formats, with signed green vinyl available in his webstore.
The full track list:
Tracklist:
1. Hello, Billy Bob
2. Raindance (ft. Native Soul)
3. Be Who You Are (ft. J.I.D, NewJeans, Camilo)
4. Worship
5. My Heart (ft. Rita Payés)
6. Drink Water (ft. Jon Bellion, Fireboy DML)
7. Calling Your Name
8. Clair De Lune (ft. Kenny G)
9. Butterfly
10. 17th Ward Prelude
11. Uneasy (ft. Lil Wayne)
12. CALL NOW (504-305-8269) (ft. Michael Batiste)
13. Chassol
14. BOOM FOR REAL
15. MOVEMENT 18’ (Heroes)
16. Master Power
17. Running Away (ft. Leigh-Anne)
18. Goodbye, Billy Bob
19. White Space
20. Wherever You Are
21. (Bonus track) Life Lesson (ft. Lana Del Rey)

title: Lana Del Rey de retour en concert à Paris, le 10 juillet prochain à l’Olympia
content:
Joseph Okpako / WireImage Joseph Okpako / WireImage
MUSIQUE - Personne ne s’y attendait, mais Lana Del Rey est de retour en France. La chanteuse âgée de 38 ans a annoncé, dans un communiqué, trois concerts à travers l’Europe pour juillet 2023, dont un à Paris. Il y a trois ans, son concert - qui devait se tenir à Bercy - avait été annulé comme le reste de sa tournée européenne.
L’interprète de Summertime Sadness se produira à Amsterdam le 4 juillet puis trois jours après à Dublin. Lana Del Rey investira l’Olympia, une salle beaucoup plus intimiste que Bercy, le 10 juillet. Ces trois concerts s’ajoutent à celui qu’elle tiendra à Hyde Park en Angleterre, le 9 juillet prochain. « J’adore l’Europe et après avoir joué à Glastonbury, j’ai décidé de jouer d’autres concerts autour de mon concert à Hyde Park. (...) J’ai hâte de vous voir tous ! » a-t-elle confié.
Vous avez refusé les cookies associés aux contenus issus de tiers en vous abonnant. Vous ne pourrez donc pas lire nos vidéos qui ont besoin de cookies tiers pour fonctionner.
Vous utilisez un bloqueur de publicité. Nous vous conseillons de le désactiver afin d’accéder à nos vidéos. Si vous n'êtes dans aucun de ces deux cas, contactez-nous à aide@huffingtonpost.fr Vous ne pouvez pas visionner ce contenu car :
Lors de son passage a Glastonbury, Lana Del Rey a vu son micro se couper suite à un retard trop important. La star était montée sur scène trente minutes après l’heure prévue. Le festival britannique devant respecter un couvre-feu était obligé de couper le son. Mais les fans de Lana Del Rey ont pu partager un moment unique avec leur idole, puisque cette dernière a chanté plusieurs chansons a capella, avec eux.
Places mises en vente dès le 30 juin
Le dernier concert de Lana Del Rey - hors festival - en France remonte à 2013. Elle était aussi montée sur scène, en 2017, lors du festival Lollapalooza à Paris. Pour le moment, les propriétaires de l’Olympia n’ont pas confirmé ce concert, mais les places devraient se vendre en un rien de temps, et sous très peu : celles du concert à Hyde Park, à Londres, sont déjà en ventes sur Ticketmaster UK, tandis que le concert prévu le 7 juillet en Irlande aura des places mises en vente le 28 juin.
À voir également sur Le HuffPost :

title: Glastonbury fans divided over who was to blame for Lana Del Rey's performance being cut off
content:
Our free email updates are the best way to get headlines direct to your inbox
People have been left divided over who was in the wrong for Lana Del Rey's Glastonbury set being cut off. The US songstress performed at the UK's biggest music festival over the weekend, but was take off after she went over the allotted time.
Thousands turned up to watch her headline the Other Stage on Saturday (June 24), but many were left frustrated as the 38-year-old was 30 minutes late. The Blue Jeans singer was scheduled to perform at 10.30pm, but didn't arrive until 11pm.
She explained to the crowd that her tardiness was due to her hair taking to long to do. Grovelling to festival-goers as she appeared on stage, she said: "I'm so f*****g late that I am about to rush this set today.
"If they cut power, they cut power. I'm super f*****g sorry, my hair takes so long to do. I love you all. Let's keep on running the set as it's supposed to go."
Before the end of her set, her microphone was cut off by festival workers as she had reached the midnight cut off point. This forced the singer-songwriter to perform her final song Video Games acapella.
The image of the artist on the big screen was then replaced with an advert for the festival's Arcadia stage as Skepta B2B Jammer's performance began. Lana Del Rey went on to mouth an apology to fans before stepping off stage to go down and greet them along the front row.
However, she was swiftly escorted off by security due to Glastonbury having a curfew, and performing past it can get the festival into a spot of bother with the local council. The whole situation has left many fans feeling mixed, with some blaming the singer for spending too long on her hair, while others argued the festival shouldn't have cut her off.
Muse frontman MattBellamy tweeted: "Can’t believe they cut Lana Del Rey sound @glastonbury before finishing set, best Glasto performance I’ve seen for years. Insanity." Pollybirkbeck argued: "But she was late! Big trouble (fines?) if set over runs the allotted curfew."
Muddymudskipper gushed: "Lana Del Rey being late and having to end her set early because she was getting her hair up real big beauty queen style is exactly what I'd expect from her (complimentary)."
Rambunctiousgus stated: "She’s literally LDR… she can be as late as she wants to?! Did you not hear her?? She said it was her hairs fault! Not hers! Stop whining, you weren’t even there lol." Readdork said: "Lana Del Rey, you may have been late, they may have cut you off, but you will go down in legend. 5 stars out of 5. #glastonbury2023."
However, Fatalliety fumed: "Exactly what paying fans want to hear I’m going to rush through my set lmfao." Nonposter10 added: "Disrespectful to loyal fans to turn up late. There's no excuse... especially just hair."
Ash_mcnally90 exclaimed: "Lana Del Rey turning up 30 mins late after having all day to do her hair is pathetic. People paying £400 for tickets and some of the artists couldn't give a f***." Simsyg ranted: "No one gets around the curfew, and using your hair taking too long as an excuse is pathetic."

title: Glastonbury fans divided over who was to blame for Lana Del Rey's performance being cut off
content:
Get the stories that matter to our community straight to your inbox with our Daily Newsletter
People have been left divided over who was in the wrong for Lana Del Rey's Glastonbury set being cut off. The US songstress performed at the UK's biggest music festival over the weekend, but was take off after she went over the allotted time.
Thousands turned up to watch her headline the Other Stage on Saturday (June 24), but many were left frustrated as the 38-year-old was 30 minutes late. The Blue Jeans singer was scheduled to perform at 10.30pm, but didn't arrive until 11pm.
She explained to the crowd that her tardiness was due to her hair taking to long to do. Grovelling to festival-goers as she appeared on stage, she said: "I'm so f*****g late that I am about to rush this set today.
"If they cut power, they cut power. I'm super f*****g sorry, my hair takes so long to do. I love you all. Let's keep on running the set as it's supposed to go."
Before the end of her set, her microphone was cut off by festival workers as she had reached the midnight cut off point. This forced the singer-songwriter to perform her final song Video Games acapella.
The image of the artist on the big screen was then replaced with an advert for the festival's Arcadia stage as Skepta B2B Jammer's performance began. Lana Del Rey went on to mouth an apology to fans before stepping off stage to go down and greet them along the front row.
However, she was swiftly escorted off by security due to Glastonbury having a curfew, and performing past it can get the festival into a spot of bother with the local council. The whole situation has left many fans feeling mixed, with some blaming the singer for spending too long on her hair, while others argued the festival shouldn't have cut her off.
Muse frontman MattBellamy tweeted: "Can’t believe they cut Lana Del Rey sound @glastonbury before finishing set, best Glasto performance I’ve seen for years. Insanity." Pollybirkbeck argued: "But she was late! Big trouble (fines?) if set over runs the allotted curfew."
Muddymudskipper gushed: "Lana Del Rey being late and having to end her set early because she was getting her hair up real big beauty queen style is exactly what I'd expect from her (complimentary)."
Rambunctiousgus stated: "She’s literally LDR… she can be as late as she wants to?! Did you not hear her?? She said it was her hairs fault! Not hers! Stop whining, you weren’t even there lol." Readdork said: "Lana Del Rey, you may have been late, they may have cut you off, but you will go down in legend. 5 stars out of 5. #glastonbury2023."
However, Fatalliety fumed: "Exactly what paying fans want to hear I’m going to rush through my set lmfao." Nonposter10 added: "Disrespectful to loyal fans to turn up late. There's no excuse... especially just hair."
Ash_mcnally90 exclaimed: "Lana Del Rey turning up 30 mins late after having all day to do her hair is pathetic. People paying £400 for tickets and some of the artists couldn't give a f***." Simsyg ranted: "No one gets around the curfew, and using your hair taking too long as an excuse is pathetic."

title: Lana Del Rey şi-a prezentat scuze pentru că a întârziat la concertul de la Glastonbury: Aranjarea părului meu a durat prea mult
content:
Concertul cântăreţei Lana Del Rey de la Glastonbury a fost întrerupt, după ce vedeta americană a ajuns pe scenă cu 30 de minute întârziere, scrie The Guardian,potrivit news.ro.
Fanii au aşteptat-o pe cântăreaţa şi compozitoarea câştigătoare a premiului Ivor Novello, care a recunoscut că apariţia sa pe scenă a fost întârziată din cauza faptului că aranjarea "părului meu a durat prea mult".
"Am întârziat atât de mult încât s-ar putea să-mi taie microfonul", a spus ea cu puţin timp înainte de miezul nopţii. "Îmi pare rău, aranjarea părului meu a durat atât de mult. Dacă vor tăia curentul, să continuăm".
Microfonul şi ecranele video au fost oprite brusc, în timp ce ea a căzut în genunchi.
Sfârşitul brusc a survenit la doar o oră după ce a urcat pe scenă pentru unul dintre cele mai aşteptate spectacole ale weekend-ului, în faţa unei mulţimi de zeci de mii.
Imagini filmate de fani au arătat-o pe artistă certându-se cu echipa de pe scenă, în timp ce se pare că a implorat să îşi termine recitalul.
Ea a încercat apoi să se adreseze mulţimii, în ciuda faptului că microfonul ei a fost oprit.
Del Rey a coborât apoi de pe scenă desculţă pentru a cânta o versiune a cappella improvizată a piesei "Summertime Sadness" fanilor suficient de apropiaţi pentru a o putea auzi.
Setul restrâns a lăsat mulţi fani dezamăgiţi. "Este oarecum devastator, pentru că... se pare că a cântat mai puţin de jumătate din setul ei, conform celor de la securitate, iar eu am venit la acest festival pentru a o vedea", a declarat Sasha Watkins pentru AP. Tânăra în vârstă de 18 ani din Londra a declarat că, în ciuda faptului că spectacolul lui Del Rey a început cu o jumătate de oră întârziere, ea "a fost bine şi s-a descurcat singură".
După ce a sosit pe scenă cu 30 de minute întârziere, Del Rey a fumat o ţigară electronică între melodiile sale - sfidând interdicţia de anul acesta de la Glastonbury de a folosi aceste dispozitive, care a fost foarte mediatizată.
Spectacolul ei a generat o mică controversă în urmă cu câteva săptămâni, când a părut să se plângă de faptul că avea un loc mai puţin proeminent pe afişul Glastonbury decât capetele de afiş de pe scena Pyramid, Arctic Monkeys, Guns N' Roses şi Elton John.
Într-un comentariu postat la anunţul de pe Instagram al festivalului, ea a scris: "Mulţumesc pentru că aţi anunţat că voi fi capul de afiş pe cealaltă scenă. Degetul mare sus".
Apoi, se pare că a intrat pe contul ei privat de Instagram unde a publicat afişul, adăugând: "Ei bine, de fapt, eu sunt capul de afiş al celei de-a doua scene. Dar, din moment ce nu a existat nicio consideraţie pentru a anunţa asta, vom vedea".

title: Lana Del Rey coming to Dublin for surprise gig next week after amazing Glastonbury set
content:
Something went wrong, please try again later.
Invalid email Something went wrong, please try again later.
Sign up to our free email alerts for the best Promotions sent straight to your e-mail
Glastonbury smash hit Lana Del Rey has revealed three more surprise dates around Europe over the next three weeks including a concert in Dublin.
Top line
Lana Del Rey has followed her incredible Glastonbury performance by announcing three surprise European concerts including one in Dublin.
The Summertime Sadness singer will play 3Arena Dublin NEXT WEEK on Friday July 7.
Tickets for Lana Del Rey at 3Arena, Dublin, are priced from €69.70 and go on sale this Friday, 30th June, at 9 am from Ticketmaster.
Lana also plays Ziggo Dome in Holland on July 4 and Olympia Paris on July 20.
READ MORE: The Weeknd at Marlay Park, Dublin: Ticket information, support acts, stage times, set list, travel, parking and more
What was said
“ I love Europe and after playing Glastonbury, have decided to play a few more shows in various countries around my Hyde Park Show in London on July 9th. Today I am announcing shows in Amsterdam on July 4th, Dublin on July 7th and Paris on July 10th. I look forward to seeing you all .”
(Image: Getty)
Glastonbury treat
The buzz surrounding Lana Del Rey 's Glastonbury performance began long before she set foot on the iconic Worthy Farm.
The 38-year-old artist took the stage fashionably late and was abruptly cut off midway through her set.
Fans eagerly awaited Lana Del Rey's headline set at The Other Stage, scheduled for 10.30pm. The anticipation grew as crowds gathered to witness the Blue Jeans singer's performance.
After an agonising 30-minute delay, Lana finally took the stage and humbly addressed the festival-goers: "I'm so f**king late that I am about to rush this set today.
(Image: Getty)
"If they cut power, they cut power. I'm super f***ing sorry, my hair takes so long to do. I love you all. Let's keep on running the set as it's supposed to go."
As the clock struck midnight, following the festival's strict curfew for the main stages, Lana's microphone was abruptly cut off. However, instead of bowing out, Lana defiantly continued, launching into her iconic hit Video Games. The crowd at The Other Stage quickly caught on and joined her in an impromptu sing-along.
What happened next
Lana decided to treat her adoring fans to a surprise meet and greet at the front of the crowd. She shook hands and posed for selfies and joined forces with her fans in a rendition of Summertime Sadness. However, the impromptu meet and greet took an unexpected turn when security intervened.
(Image: Getty)
Filmed footage captured the moment Lana was escorted away from the crowd, leaving her fans in a mix of emotions. Some expressed their disappointment with boos, while others cried out and screamed, yearning for more.
